HomePage.title: GitHub Release Monitor
HomePage.load_error: Failed to load repository data. Check server logs.
HomePage.toast_refresh_success_description: Repository data has been successfully reloaded. No new releases found.
HomePage.toast_refresh_found_new: Successfully refreshed. New releases found and notifications sent.
HomePage.toast_refresh_error_description: Could not update data. Please try again later.
HomePage.toast_export_success_description: The repository list is ready for download.
HomePage.toast_export_error_description: Could not read repository data for export.
HomePage.error_summary_line: {count, plural, =1 {# repository} other {# repositories}} had the following issue: {errorText}

RepositoryForm.title: Add Repositories
RepositoryForm.description: Enter one GitHub repository URL per line, or import a JSON file.
RepositoryForm.toast_generic_error: An unexpected error occurred. Please check server logs.
RepositoryForm.toast_save_error_generic: Failed to save repository file. Please check server logs and file permissions.
RepositoryForm.toast_import_success_description: {addedCount, plural, =0 {} =1 {# new repository added.} other {# new repositories added.}}{addedCount, plural, =0 {{updatedCount, plural, =0 {No changes made.} =1 {# repository updated.} other {# repositories updated.}}} other {{updatedCount, plural, =0 {} =1 { # repository updated.} other { # repositories updated.}}}}
RepositoryForm.toast_import_error_reading: Could not read the selected file.
RepositoryForm.toast_import_error_parsing: Could not parse the JSON file. Is it corrupted?
RepositoryForm.toast_import_error_invalid_format: The JSON file format is invalid. It should be an array of objects with a 'url' key.
RepositoryForm.import_dialog_description: The selected file contains {newCount, plural, =0 {no new repositories} =1 {# new repository} other {# new repositories}} and {existingCount, plural, =0 {no} =1 {one} other {#}} already monitored repositories. Already monitored entries will be updated with data from the file. Proceed?

ReleaseCard.custom_settings_tooltip: This repository is using custom settings.
ReleaseCard.confirm_dialog_description_long: This will remove <bold>{repoId}</bold> from your monitoring list. This action cannot be undone.
ReleaseCard.no_release_notes: No release notes provided for this version.
ReleaseCard.toast_acknowledge_error_generic: Could not update the 'seen' status. Please try again.
ReleaseCard.toast_mark_as_new_success: The repository was successfully marked as 'new'.
ReleaseCard.toast_mark_as_new_error_generic: Could not set the 'new' status. Please try again.

EmptyState.title: Start Observing
EmptyState.description_line1: You are not monitoring any repositories yet.
EmptyState.description_line2: Add some GitHub repository URLs above to get started.

SettingsForm.title: Display Settings
SettingsForm.description: Customize how information is displayed across the application.
SettingsForm.toast_error_description: Could not save settings to the file.
SettingsForm.automation_settings_description: Configure background refresh intervals and API-related parameters.
SettingsForm.refresh_interval_error_min: The refresh interval must be at least 1 minute.
SettingsForm.refresh_interval_error_max: The refresh interval exceeds the maximum of about 10 years.
SettingsForm.releases_per_page_label: Number of releases to fetch per repository
SettingsForm.releases_per_page_error_min: The number must be at least 1.
SettingsForm.apprise_max_chars_hint: Set to 0 to disable the limit. Useful for services like Discord (limit ~2000).
SettingsForm.apprise_max_chars_disabled_hint: This option is disabled because the Apprise URL is not configured.
SettingsForm.cache_settings_description: Configure how long release data is cached on the server to reduce API calls. Set to 0 to disable cache.
SettingsForm.cache_validation_error: Cache duration cannot be longer than the refresh interval.
SettingsForm.release_channel_description: Define global rules to control which releases are monitored.
SettingsForm.release_channel_description_global: These filters are applied if no 'Include' regex is defined.
SettingsForm.release_channel_description_repo: These filters are ignored if an 'Include' regex is active for this repository.
SettingsForm.prerelease_subtype_description: Select the specific pre-release types to monitor.
SettingsForm.release_channel_error_at_least_one: At least one release type must be selected.
SettingsForm.regex_filter_description: Use regular expressions for fine-grained control over release tags. The 'exclude' pattern always takes priority. If an 'include' regex is present, the release type filters above will be ignored.
SettingsForm.regex_filter_description_repo: Override the global regex filters. An empty field means the global setting will be used.
SettingsForm.show_acknowledge_description: Highlights new releases and provides buttons for status management.
SettingsForm.show_mark_as_new_description: Displays a button to manually re-mark an already seen release as new.
SettingsForm.danger_zone_description: These are destructive actions that should be used with caution.
SettingsForm.delete_all_dialog_description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete all of your monitored repositories.
SettingsForm.toast_delete_all_success_description: Your entire repository list has been successfully deleted.
SettingsForm.toast_delete_all_error_description: Failed to delete repositories. Check server logs.

RepoSettingsDialog.title: Repository Settings
RepoSettingsDialog.description_flexible: Customize settings for <repoId></repoId>. Untouched or empty sections will use the global defaults.
RepoSettingsDialog.releases_per_page_hint_individual: Using individual setting. Leave blank to use global.
RepoSettingsDialog.release_channel_error_at_least_one: At least one release type must be selected when overriding global settings.
RepoSettingsDialog.reset_all_dialog_description: This will undo any changes and revert to the global default settings for this repository.

TestPage.title: System Configuration Test
TestPage.github_card_description: Checks connectivity and authentication with GitHub.
TestPage.token_advice: The app will work, but you may be rate-limited by GitHub (60 requests/hour). Add a token to your .env file for a higher limit (5000 requests/hour).
TestPage.rate_limit_fail: Could not fetch rate limit data.
TestPage.invalid_token_error: Authentication failed. The provided token may be invalid or expired.
TestPage.invalid_token_advice: Please check your GITHUB_ACCESS_TOKEN in the .env file.
TestPage.email_card_description: Checks if email notification variables are set.
TestPage.email_recipient_placeholder: Defaults to the address in MAIL_TO_ADDRESS
TestPage.invalid_email_format: Please enter a valid email address.
TestPage.toast_email_success_description: Test email sent. Please check your inbox.
TestPage.toast_email_error_description: Failed to send email. Check server logs.
TestPage.email_password_warning: Warning: Your email password is shown below. Ensure this page is not publicly accessible.
TestPage.notification_card_description: Test the entire notification pipeline, from detection to dispatch, using a virtual repository.
TestPage.e2e_step1_description: Adds the virtual 'test/test' repository to the monitoring list or resets its state. It will appear on the home page, ready for a simulated release.
TestPage.toast_setup_test_repo_error: Could not set up the test repository.
TestPage.e2e_step2_description: Manually runs the check process. If notification services are configured, it should detect a new release for 'test/test' and send a notification.
TestPage.toast_trigger_check_success_email_sent: Check finished. A notification has been dispatched.
TestPage.toast_trigger_check_success_no_email: Check finished. No new release requiring notification was found.
TestPage.toast_trigger_check_error: The release check process failed to run.
TestPage.email_config_required_tooltip: Email settings must be configured to use this feature.
TestPage.notification_config_required_tooltip: At least one notification service (SMTP or Apprise) must be configured.
TestPage.toast_no_notification_service_configured: No notification service (neither SMTP nor Apprise) is configured.
TestPage.apprise_card_description: Checks the connectivity to your Apprise service.
TestPage.apprise_connection_error_fetch: Could not connect to Apprise service. Please check the URL and ensure the service is running.
TestPage.apprise_connection_error_status: Apprise service responded with status code {status}.
TestPage.toast_apprise_not_configured_error: Apprise URL is not set in environment variables.

Email.subject: New Release for {repoId}: {tagName}
Email.text_new_version_of: A new version of {repoId} has been released.
Email.html_intro: A new version of {repoId} has been released.
Email.html_no_notes: No release notes were provided for this version.
Email.error_config_incomplete: Email configuration is incomplete. Please check your .env file.
Email.error_send_failed: Failed to process and send email: {details}

LoginPage.title: Login to GitHub Release Monitor
LoginPage.form_description: Enter your credentials to access the GitHub Release Monitor.

Actions.error_invalid_url: Invalid GitHub URL. Please check the input.
Actions.error_rate_limit: GitHub API rate limit hit. Please try again later or add an API token.
Actions.error_repo_not_found: Repository not found. It might be private, deleted, or misspelled.
Actions.error_no_matching_releases: No releases found that match your filter settings. Try increasing the number of releases to fetch in the settings.

TestRelease.title: Full Markdown Test Release
TestRelease.body_intro: This is a comprehensive test of all supported Markdown features to ensure they render correctly in both the UI and email notifications.
TestRelease.text_blockquote: This is a blockquote. It should be indented and styled differently from the rest of the text.
TestRelease.emojis_text: Emojis are also supported, like these:
TestRelease.footnotes_text_1: Here's a sentence with a footnote
TestRelease.footnote_2_definition: This is the second footnote, which can be longer and contain more details.
TestRelease.code_inline_text: This is an example of some {code} to test the behavior.
TestRelease.code_fenced_js_comment: This is a javascript code block
